wrapScienceJ.process

Interface GenericProcess

  • All Superinterfaces:
    InputOutputPolicy
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    GenericImageProcess, PluginFilterWrap
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Blur3DThresholdOtsuComponents3D, BlurProcess, ConnectedComponentsProcess, ConnectedComponentsSegmentation, GenericImageProcessConcrete, GenericImageProcessNode, GenericImageProcessSequence, GenericProcessConcrete, GenericProcessNode, GenericProcessSequence, PluginFilterGeneric, ProcessImageGuiDisplayGeneric, ProcessImageInputOutputGeneric, ThresholdingProcess

    public interface GenericProcess
extends InputOutputPolicy
    Represents a hierarchical structure of processes, using the Composite and Visitor Pattern Each concrete process is intended to execute a method runProcess(), can optionally use an Object as parameter, and can optionally return an Object. The Generic Process is characterized by a String description, which should be human readable and preferably unique to avoid confusion, especially since some operations use the description as a unique key. The Generic Process usually takes a set of parameters as part of its input, which is generally accessible through an abstract method called getConfig() and the GenericProcessConfig class.
    See Also:
    MetaDataContainer, AttributeData, Since the GenericProcessConfig contains references to a number of AttributeData, the instance returned by getConfig() can be modified to adapt to a specific use of the Generic Process. This modification can be set through access to a configuration file, which is contained in a directory specified by a String parameter for getConfig(). The modification of the process's parameter might also be obtained by any kind of request (e.g. network stream request of HTTPS API request), including Graphical User Interface request. The policy for managing and updating configs can be
    • "overwrite": An existing config is overwritten if a new config is obtained;
    • "Always ask": A new configuration is sought at each invocation without changing the default config (the GenericProcessConfig.duplicate() method can be used)
    • "Always use default": No configuration input is sought at all and the configuration is taken as is, assumed to be "one size fits all"

      • runProcess

        java.lang.Object runProcess(java.lang.Object arg,
                            java.lang.String option)
        Parameters:
        arg - a generic argument if the process requires additional data or methods
        option - An optional string transmitted to the process (e.g. directory, path, etc.)
        Returns:
        a generic object in case the process is required to return an object
